channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2024010517
item.description:
Report E-2024010517

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3264 ARSURF 9590 SURFACTANT release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 40-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete dock floor as well as a 2’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a container failure. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and Color Safe for Acids neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean the release. All impacted absorbents and PPE were then containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010723
item.description:
Report X-2024010723

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet in QA damage area and moved to Hazmat area for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the 2 plastic containers exhibited a small leak when turned over and did not leak again after cap was tightened with a small twist. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was in upright condition and not actively leaking when found. Box was placed in a salvage drum for transport to Hazmat area.

item.title: Report E-2024010524
item.description:
Report E-2024010524

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 24, 2024, one (1) 50-gallon drum of UN3259 was crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket. The damaged 50-gallon drum of product was patched and placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024010482
item.description:
Report E-2024010482

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 24, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was cracked by personnel during unloading and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted concrete and swept them in with hand tools. GME located the leaking pail and overpacked it using one (1) 55-gallon All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024010484
item.description:
Report E-2024010484

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LAB experienced a UN3082 DiCash DGA-4 release from a 265-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 4’ plastic containment. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then deployed to clean the impacted area and then containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Powder was coming out of the box when I came to inspect. Vanline Mgr informed me that the box was damaged and gave me no specific details. DescribePack: The cap wasn't totally sealed and powder came out from apparent mishandling of the box, possibly box was flipped on its side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Instant in house cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024010687
item.description:
Report X-2024010687

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: SPRING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was unloaded from trailer, after handling the package was found releasing internally. package was removed from the sortation, spill contained in packaging. DescribePack: packaging didn't fail, the body of the plastic pail in the overpack failed. the base of the pail suffered an impact causing the integrity of the base to give. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package placed on its side in hazmat containment tote. plastic pail kept inside box housing for containment.

item.title: Report X-2024010482
item.description:
Report X-2024010482

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T00:33:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: Bloomington
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During routine tankcar inspections Josh Carrillo found what looked to be a release of material on top of the tankcar RCRX 1409. Further inspection showed missing bolts on the liquid eduction line resulting in release. The car was made secure and decontaminated tankcar.
